OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS FOR CENTREX 
NOTRE DAME AND ST. MARY’S CAMPUS CALLS: Dial the 4 digit extension number. 
LOCAL CALLS: Dial “9” then the seven digit number. 
CAMPUS DIRECTORY ASSISTANCE: If not listed in directory -Dial “0”. 
ST. MARY’SDIRECTORY ASSISTANCE: Consult St. Mary’s Directory -Ifnot listed -Dial “0”. 
LOCAL DIRECTORY ASSISTANCE: Dial “9” -then 113. 
REPAIR AND ASSISTANCE: If your telephone is not working properly, or you need assistance with a call -Dial “0”. 
DIRECTORY CHANGES: Directory changes should be reported as they occur to Personnel Department. Changes include additions, deletions, number changes, corrections in Directory, etc. 
TO TRANSFER CALLS: Incoming calls ONLY may be transferred. Depress the receiver hook 1 time and release the operator will answer and you give her your request. 
WHEN OFF CAMPUS DIALING CAMPUS NUMBERS' Dial ALL seven digits. If you do not know the num­ber, dial the Notre Dame listed number -283-6011. 
LONG DISTANCE-DIRECT DISTANCE DIALING: Dial “9”. Dial “1”. 
Dial the area code. Then dial the seven digit number. 
STUDENTS: GIVE THE OPERATOR YOUR SPECIAL BILLING NUMBER WHEN REQUESTED. 
ADMINISTRATIVE: GIVE THE OPERATOR THE NUMBER ASSIGNED TO YOU WHEN REQUESTED. 
TO REACH THE LONG DISTANCE OPERATOR: Dial “9” then “0”. 
CONFERENCE CALLS: Conference calls can be placed from any station on campus by dialing “55” for the conference operator. It is possible to have five conferees on one conference call. 
SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS FOR STUDENTS: Long Distance Collect calls incoming are not to be accepted from any source. A penalty of $5.00 will be 
. assessed by the Universtiy for each collect toll call accepted by a student. 
TO REPORT AN EMERGENCY: Dial 6600 in case of serious accident or illness and give the dispatcher 
1. 
Location of victim. 

2. 
Name of victim, if known. 

3. 
Name of calling party. 

4. 
Extension number of calling party. 


IN MAKINGANYCALLBESURETOWAITFORTHE DIAL TONE. DIAL EACHDIGITCAREFULLY.

(Consult directory for additional listings) (On All Local Calls from a Campus Phone—Dial "9" and the seven digit number) 
LONG DISTANCE—STUDENTS 1. Dial “9”. 2. Dial "1". 
3. Dial area code. 
4. Dial seven digit number. 

5. GIVE THE OPERATOR YOUR SPECIAL BILLING NUMBER.

NOTRE DAME-SAINT MARY’S SHUTTLE BUS SCHEDULE 
Fall Semester 1971-72 
LOCAL SERVICE LOCAL SERVICE LOCAL SERVICE 
Academic Hours: Monday through Friday (8:05 a. m. to 5:30 p.m.) Locals will depart simultaneously from each campus at the following times (except where 
indicated).  
M W F  T T

SHUTTLE SERVICE DURING NON -ACADEMIC HOURS 
Beginning at 5:50 p.m. Monday through Friday and all day Saturday and Sunday a 
10 cent fee will be charged. The operation of these "fee" buses will be asfollows: Monday through Friday -6:00 p.m. to 12:30 a.m. Friday -6:00 p.m. to 3:3&a.m. Saturday -12:00 noon to 3:30 a.m. Sunday -12:00 noon to 12:30 a.m. 
EXACT FARES ONLY WILLBE ACCEPTED 
LOCAL BUS ROUTES 

TO SAINT MARY'S COLLEGE: Rear of Nieuwland Science; Power Plant; Library Circle; Bus Shelter; R.O.T.C. Building; Grotto and on to Saint Mary's Campus. 
TO UNIV. OF NOTRE DAME: JVIoreau Parking Lot; McCandless Hall; Madeleva Memorial and on to Notre Dame's Campus. 
ND* = From ND Campus only SMC = From SMC Campus only. 

EXPRESS SERVICE EXPRESS SERVICE EXPRESS SERVICE 
Express service to insure student transportation to opposite campus in the 15 minutes between classes. EXPRESS BUS ROUTES 
TO SAINT MARY'S COLLEGE: Departs at the rear of Nieuwland and stops atthe Grotto. 
TO UNIV. OF NOTRE DAME: Departs in front of Madeleva and from Moreau Parking Lot. These buses will depart from each campus three (3) minutes after the end of each class. 
The following arethe times for the non-stop buses. 
MWF TT

EXPRESS SERVICE 
EXPRESS SERVICE 

Express service to insure student transportation to opposite campus in the 15 minutes between classes. EXPRESS BUS ROUTES 
TO SAINT MARY'S COLLEGE: Departs at the rear of Nieuwland and stops at the Grotto. 
TO UNIV. OF NOTRE DAME: Departs in front of Madeleva and from Moreau Parking Lot. These buses will depart from each campus three (3) minutes after the end of each class.

DIRECTORY ACCURACY 

Every effort is made to make the directory as accurate as possible. In case of error or omission the liability of Plains Publications, if any, is limited to the amount of actual im­pairment of the customer's service and may not, in any event, exceed the amount paid for the service during the period covered by the directory in which the error or omis­sion occurred.
